activities.loc: Parties to appear remotely via Zoom (SC-3122)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:28 AM - Case not called on the Record

Defendant Andrew T Van Alstine in court.  
Attorney Jensen requests another hearing date.  Court grants.

fax, dated 08-29-2022 from Joe Barrie, Midwest Community Services, requesting the defendant and his guardians be allowed to appear remotely via Zoom for the hearing on 09-02-2022.  
**reviewed by the court on 08-29-2022:  all parties approved to appear remotely by Zoom.
signed on 07-22-2022 by defendant and surety
Hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ONE OF THE GUARDIANS NEEDS TO SIGN THE BOND AS WELL (Defendant's parents).
Defendant to have no contact with victim A (incidental contact is allowed as they live in the same apartment building) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Further, the Defendant is order to complete ID processing within five (5) business days.   Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

08:27 AM Defendant Andrew T Van Alstine appeared by Zoom with SPD Intern, Patrick Sicula, for attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Legal Guardian's for Andrew Van Alstine appeared by Zoom.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Jensen is appointed.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Further, the Defendant is order to complete ID processing within five (5) business days.   Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jeffrey Jensen
Initial appearance on July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:21 AM Defendant Andrew T Van Alstine in court with his caseworker Joe Barrie.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Attorney Jeffrey Jensen Jr. appeared as a friend of the Court.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance to allow for notice to be provided to the defendant's guardians for them to be present at the next hearing.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
